radiographic_examinations.findings: Very distended abdomen, possibly hepatosplenomegaly or ascites.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: X-ray of the swelling in the right arm
radiographic_examinations.findings: Periosteal reaction in the right radius with small cystic lesions in the proximal humerus and abnormal bone quality.
Normal thoracic cage, spine, and pelvic bones with areas of destruction in the proximal shaft of the left humerus and distal shaft of the right femur.

Thin corpus callosum, no intracranial hemorrhage or infarctions, maintained gray-white matter differentiation, normal ventricles, sulci, and basal cisterns. Opacification of the pneumatized ethmoid air cells and bilateral maxillary sinuses; more marked on the left side in the mastoid air cells. Unremarkable osseous structures.

Normal cardiac segments with a small patent foramen ovale, normal mitral and tricuspid valves, normal aortic and pulmonary valves, and normal ventricle morphology. Evidence of branch stenosis in the pulmonary arteries with a peak gradient of 28 mmHg.
